page.title: 10FARMING - DAIRY
page.content: {EMLEY OLD HALL FARM}(254122) is on the site of an ancient moated dwelling. The present buildings date from the l8th century. This is a {DAIRY FARM }owned by Saville Estates and tenanted by Mr. N.R.Abbott. The farm is 2o2 acres including buildings of which 196 acres is grass. Mr.Abbott employs 2 labourers. {LIVESTOCK} COWS 130; HEIFERS 70; CALVES 10. MR. ABBOTT milks 130 cows each day at 5.30 a.m. and again at 3.30 p.m.The cows are milked in a {MILKING PARLOUR} l6 at a time, milking taking 2 hours to complete. {MILK YIELD} for one week is 12,000 litres, highest yielding cow giving 33 litres a day.Milk is sold to{HILLDALE {DAIRIES},a consortium of local farmers,who then bottle and retail it.
